congratulationsCaption: Look at you. You are now an expert. If you want to know more, check out our
createCourseOnboardingTaskDescription:
What for?
Creating a new course has never been easier. Do you have a topic? It can be anything â from accounting to business writing to time management. Or, here are some additional suggestions:
  • Basic HTML
  • Statistics 101
  • Pythagorean theorem
How to create a course?
  1. Click on "New course" in the list of courses
  2. Enter the title of your first course
Read more
defineObjectiveOnboardingTaskDescription:
What for?
Specify what exactly you want students to know or be able to do at the end of the course.
How to define an objective?
  1. Click on "New objective/section" in the course editor
Read more
addContentOnboardingTaskDescription:
What for?
Give learners the information they need to be able to answer the question. Create visually engaging courses by embedding videos and images.
How to add content?
  1. After you have added (or opened) a learning objective, a new page will be displayed.
  2. Click on "New item" and click on "Content"
  3. Enter a title and add your content
Read more
createQuestionsOnboardingTaskDescription:
What for?
Engage users by using different question types like: Drag and Drop Text, Text Matching, Single Choice Image and many more.
How to add questions?
  1. Click on "New item" (On the Learning objective page, or on the page on which you create questions or content)
  2. Select the question type you want to create
  3. Enter a question title and other properties
  4. Create a minimum of 3 questions
Read more
publishOnboardingTaskDescription:
What for?
Publish to the cloud with one click.
How to publish?
  1. Click on "Publish now" on any course page
  2. Click on "Get link"
  3. Copy the link and share it via mail, twitter or any other channel
Read more
tooltipContentDescription:
Learning content is the content the learner needs to be able to answer a question.

In easygenerator this content can be added directly to the question.

The template you choose in the Design step determines how the content and the question will be organized and presented to the learner.
tooltipFibDescription:
Use a fill in the blanks question to check active knowledge in the context of a text.

The learner is presented with text with blank spaces. There are two options â the learner can enter the text in the blank spaces, or choose the correct text from a drop-down list.
tooltipTextMatchingDescription:
A text matching question tests the ability to match corresponding terms to each other.

The learner is presented with a question consisting of two lists and is asked to drag the listed terms to the correct match or definition.
tooltipDragAndDropDescription:
Use Drag and Drop questions when the user needs to recognize and name parts of an image.

A question with a background image is provided and the leaner needs to drop the correct text label to the corresponding spot.
tooltipCourseTemplateDescription:
A course template determines how a course is organized and functions.

Easygenerator is flexible, allowing content to be presented in different formats.

Click on âPreview course templateâ to see what each template is. Select the correct template before publishing.
tooltipStatementDescription:
The learner is presented with a list of statements and has to indicate if they are true or false.

Examples:

[True] Five is a prime number
[False] The Atlantic Ocean is the largest ocean on earth.

How to:

      1. Define the title (Question)
      2. Enter statements
      3. Select true or false for all the statements
tooltipHotspotDescription:
The learner is presented with an image and has to click on one or more places in order to give an answer:

Example: "Geography: Locate areas on a map".

Options:

  • Single response â learners can only select one area. If there are several hotspots to choose from, the question is answered correctly when the learner clicks on ANY of the hotspots.
  • Multiple response â learners can select multiple areas. The question is answered correctly when the learner clicks ALL hotspots without selecting any wrong areas.

How to:

      1. Define the title (Question)
      2. Upload the image
      3. Choose between single and multiple response
      4. Create your hotspots
